sen.j: 無形文化財（むけいぶんかざい）は、
sen.e: The term "intangible cultural properties"
The term "intangible cultural properties"
The term "intangible cultural properties"

sen.j: 広義では、人類の文化的活動によって生み出された無形の文化的所産全般を意味する。
sen.e: generally means intangible cultural products produced by human cultural activities in a broad sense.
generally means intangible cultural products produced by human cultural activities in a broad sense.
generally means intangible cultural products produced by human cultural activities in a broad sense.

sen.j: 狭義では、日本の文化財保護法や地方公共団体の条例における文化財の種類のひとつで、音楽や工芸技術などの無形の文化的所産を意味する。
sen.e: In a narrow sense, it means intangible cultural products such as music and applied arts, which belong to one category of cultural properties specified by Japan's Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties or ordinances of local public bodies.

In a narrow sense, it means intangible cultural products such as music and applied arts, which belong to one category of cultural properties specified by the Act on Protection of Cultural Properties of Japan or ordinances of local public bodies.
sen.cmt: Japan's Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties をthe Act on Protection of Cultural Properties of Japan に修正しました。
sen.e: In a narrow sense, it means intangible cultural products such as music and applied arts, which belong to one category of cultural properties specified by the Act on Protection of Cultural Properties of Japan or ordinances of local public bodies.

sen.j: 特に、文化財保護法第2条第1項第2号において規定された「無形文化財」を意味する。
sen.e: In particular, it means "intangible cultural properties" provided by Article 2, Paragraph 1, Item (2) of the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties.
In particular, it means 'intangible cultural properties' provided by Article 2, Paragraph 1, Item (2) of the Act on Protection of Cultural Properties.
sen.cmt: Law for the を Act on に修正しました。ダブルコーテーションをシングルコーテーションに修正しました。
sen.e: In particular, it means 'intangible cultural properties' provided by Article 2, Paragraph 1, Item (2) of the Act on Protection of Cultural Properties.

sen.j: 本項では2について詳述する。
sen.e: In this article, above 2 is described in detail.
In this article, above 2 is described in detail.
In this article, above 2 is described in detail.

sen.j: 日本の文化財保護法第2条第1項第2号では、演劇、音楽、工芸技術その他の無形の文化的所産で、日本国にとって歴史上又は芸術上価値の高いものを、「無形文化財」と定義している。
sen.e: Article 2, Paragraph 1, Item (2) of the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties defines "intangible cultural properties" as "art and skill employed in drama, music and applied arts, and other intangible cultural products which possess a high historical and/or artistic value in and for Japan.

Article 2, Paragraph 1, Item (2) of the Act on Protection of Cultural Properties defines 'intangible cultural properties' as art and skill employed in drama, music and applied arts, and other intangible cultural products which possess a high historical and/or artistic value in and for Japan.
sen.cmt: Law for the を Act on に修正しました。ダブルコーテーションをシングルコーテーションに修正しました。
sen.e: Article 2, Paragraph 1, Item (2) of the Act on Protection of Cultural Properties defines 'intangible cultural properties' as art and skill employed in drama, music and applied arts, and other intangible cultural products which possess a high historical and/or artistic value in and for Japan.

sen.j: 地方公共団体の文化財保護条例等においても同様に、文化財の種類の一つとして「無形文化財」を規定している場合がある。
sen.e: Similarly, some ordinances of local public bodies specify "intangible cultural properties" as one category of cultural properties.
Similarly, some ordinances of local public bodies specify 'intangible cultural properties' as one category of cultural properties.
sen.cmt: ダブルコーテーションをシングルコーテーションに修正しました。
sen.e: Similarly, some ordinances of local public bodies specify 'intangible cultural properties' as one category of cultural properties.

sen.j: 文化財保護法では、無形文化財の中から重要無形文化財および「記録作成等の措置を講ずべき無形の文化財」を指定および選択し、指定された重要無形文化財の保持者または保持団体を認定し、保護する制度を定めている。
sen.e: The Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties stipulates a protection system in which among intangible cultural properties, important intangible cultural properties and "intangible cultural properties requiring special measures such as the creation of records" are selected and holders or holder groups of the designated properties are recognized and protected.

The Act on Protection of Cultural Properties stipulates a protection system in which among intangible cultural properties, important intangible cultural properties and 'intangible cultural properties requiring special measures such as the creation of records' are selected and holders or holder groups of the designated properties are recognized and protected.
sen.cmt: Law for the を Act on に修正しました。ダブルコーテーションをシングルコーテーションに修正しました。
sen.e: The Act on Protection of Cultural Properties stipulates a protection system in which among intangible cultural properties, important intangible cultural properties and 'intangible cultural properties requiring special measures such as the creation of records' are selected and holders or holder groups of the designated properties are recognized and protected.

sen.j: 重要無形文化財（第71条第1項）：文部科学大臣は、無形文化財のうち重要なものを「重要無形文化財」に指定することができる。
sen.e: Important intangible cultural properties (Article 71, Paragraph 1): The Minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology may designate important items of intangible cultural properties as "important intangible cultural properties".

Important intangible cultural properties (Article 71, Paragraph 1): The Minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology may designate important items of intangible cultural properties as 'important intangible cultural properties.'
sen.cmt: ダブルコーテーションをシングルコーテーションに修正しました。
sen.e: Important intangible cultural properties (Article 71, Paragraph 1): The Minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology may designate important items of intangible cultural properties as 'important intangible cultural properties.'

sen.j: 文化庁長官は、重要無形文化財の保存のため必要があるときは、重要無形文化財について記録の作成、伝承者の養成その他その保存のため適当な措置を執ることができる。
sen.e: The Commissioner of the Agency for Cultural Affairs may, whenever he deems it necessary for preservation of important intangible cultural properties, take measures for creation of records of important intangible cultural properties and training of successors and other appropriate measures required for preservation thereof.

The Commissioner of the Agency for Cultural Affairs may, whenever he deems it necessary for preservation of important intangible cultural properties, take measures for creation of records of important intangible cultural properties and training of successors and other appropriate measures required for preservation thereof.

The Commissioner of the Agency for Cultural Affairs may, whenever he deems it necessary for preservation of important intangible cultural properties, take measures for creation of records of important intangible cultural properties and training of successors and other appropriate measures required for preservation thereof.

sen.j: 重要無形文化財の保持者又は保持団体（第71条第2項）：文部科学大臣は、重要無形文化財を指定するに当たっては、その重要無形文化財の保持者または保持団体を認定しなければならない。
sen.e: The Minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology shall, in making the designation of important intangible cultural properties, recognize the holders or holder groups of such important intangible cultural properties.

Holders or holder groups of important intangible cultural properties (Article 71, Paragraph 2): The Minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology shall, in making the designation of important intangible cultural properties, recognize the holders or holder groups of such important intangible cultural properties.
sen.cmt: 「重要無形文化財の保持者又は保持団体（第71条第2項）：」訳漏れのため、Holders or holder groups of important intangible cultural properties (Article 71, Paragraph 2): を追記して対応しました。
sen.e: Holders or holder groups of important intangible cultural properties (Article 71, Paragraph 2): The Minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology shall, in making the designation of important intangible cultural properties, recognize the holders or holder groups of such important intangible cultural properties.

sen.j: 保持者認定には、個人を各個別に認定する各個認定と、複数の保持者を一体として認定する総合認定がある。
sen.e: Forms of recognition of holders include individual recognition in which each individual holder is recognized, and collective recognition in which two or more individuals are recognized as one holder group.

Forms of recognition of holders include individual recognition in which each individual holder is recognized, and collective recognition in which two or more individuals are recognized as one holder group.

Forms of recognition of holders include individual recognition in which each individual holder is recognized, and collective recognition in which two or more individuals are recognized as one holder group.

sen.j: 各個認定を受けた重要無形文化財保持者を、日本国政府も人間国宝と呼んでいるが、これは法律で規定された用語ではない。
sen.e: Although a person individually recognized as a holder of an important intangible cultural property is called Living National Treasure commonly and by Japan's national government, this term is not specified by laws.

Although a person individually recognized as a holder of an important intangible cultural property is called Living National Treasure commonly and by Japan's national government, this term is not specified by laws.

Although a person individually recognized as a holder of an important intangible cultural property is called Living National Treasure commonly and by Japan's national government, this term is not specified by laws.

sen.j: 記録作成等の措置を講ずべき無形の文化財（第77条）：文化庁長官は、重要無形文化財以外の無形文化財のうち特に必要のあるものを選択して、その記録を作成し、保存し、または公開するための措置を講ずることができる。
sen.e: Intangible cultural properties requiring measures such as creation of records (Article 77): The Commissioner of the Agency for Cultural Affairs may take measures for creation of records, preservation and publication of items which he selects among intangible cultural properties as particularly requiring such measures, other than those designated as important intangible cultural properties.

Intangible cultural properties requiring measures such as creation of records (Article 77): The Commissioner of the Agency for Cultural Affairs may take measures for creation of records, preservation and publication of items which he selects among intangible cultural properties as particularly requiring such measures, other than those designated as important intangible cultural properties.

Intangible cultural properties requiring measures such as creation of records (Article 77): The Commissioner of the Agency for Cultural Affairs may take measures for creation of records, preservation and publication of items which he selects among intangible cultural properties as particularly requiring such measures, other than those designated as important intangible cultural properties.

sen.j: これを選択無形文化財ともいうが、法律で規定された用語ではない。
sen.e: Although such items are commonly called "selected intangible cultural properties", the term is not defined by laws.
Although such items are commonly called "selected intangible cultural properties," the term is not defined by laws.
sen.cmt: カンマをコーテーション内に移動しました。
sen.e: Although such items are commonly called "selected intangible cultural properties," the term is not defined by laws.

tit.j: 地方公共団体による保護

sen.j: 地方公共団体では、それぞれ文化財保護条例を定めて、国が指定する無形文化財以外の無形文化財のうち、その地方公共団体にとって重要なものを「都道府県指定無形文化財」、「市町村指定無形文化財」などの形で指定している。
sen.e: Each local public body institutes regulations for protection of cultural properties to select intangible cultural properties important for the body, other than important intangible cultural properties designated by the national government, and designates such properties as "Intangible Cultural Properties Designated by Prefecture" or "Intangible Cultural Properties Designated by Municipality".

Each local public body institutes regulations for protection of cultural properties to select intangible cultural properties important for the body, other than important intangible cultural properties designated by the national government, and designates such properties as 'Intangible Cultural Properties Designated by Prefecture' or 'Intangible Cultural Properties Designated by Municipality.'
sen.cmt: ダブルコーテーションをシングルコーテーションに修正しました。文末のピリオドをコーテーション内に移動しました。
sen.e: Each local public body institutes regulations for protection of cultural properties to select intangible cultural properties important for the body, other than important intangible cultural properties designated by the national government, and designates such properties as 'Intangible Cultural Properties Designated by Prefecture' or 'Intangible Cultural Properties Designated by Municipality.'
